intro: Cacalia rugosa, commonly known as the rough cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are rough and hairy, providing a distinctive texture, while its flowers bloom in shades of white to pale yellow. Cacalia rugosa is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
